ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This semester I worked on an independent project in conjunction with Columbia university and participated in lab meetings and which grad students presented summations of their work.
I learned how to code dog videos through Borris, and I also learned many psychology studies through working at the Canine Cognition Center

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: flexible lab schedules and it's great that the only real assignment other than participating in lab meetings is the end of term paper
Weaknesses: none!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. Doing research in a lab for 0.5 credits is a great experience and teaches you more about your future career than any course can.
Yes!! You will learn so much.
Yes, it is great to do research and learn from professors and grad students.
Working in a psychology lab has given me incredible perspective on psychological methods as well as scientific works from start to finish. Working with Arielle has been an absolute pleasure.
Yes! Taking research for credit is always nice because you receive hands-on experience doing research while getting credit take contributes towards the 36 distributional requirements!
